data.title: The Finnish Medical Foundation
data.meta_description: The Finnish Medical Foundation awards scholarships to Finnish medical researchers and students. The Finnish Medical Society Duodecim established the foundation in 1960.
data.text:
The annual value of the scholarships awarded exceeds 2 million euros. The scholarships are funded by the foundation’s investment returns.

Scholarships are divided into three categories:

Research group founder’s grants are awarded to high-quality research projects with a topic that has been given priority by the Foundation (typically 150.000-200.000 euros for three years)

Research scholarships enable the recipient to work full-time or part-time for 6-24 months on a research project (typically 13 500 – 60 000 euros)

Encouragement scholarships are awarded to PhD students preparing a doctoral thesis or to beginning a career in research (typically up to 5 000 euros)

Grants are awarded to medical (M.D.) researchers and M.D. students and dental researchers and dental students.

Applications can be submitted once a year in May.
